roleset.name: near or surrounding a bladder or cyst

role.descr: thing that is near or surrounds ARG1

example.name: common usage
example.text: A pericystic lymph node is identified .

example.name: cystic doing non-standard double-time; only annotate as part of the frame
example.text: Three pericystic duct lymph nodes positive for adenocarcinoma .
example.amr: (p / positive-03 :ARG1 (a / anatomical-site :quant 3 :name (n / name :op1 "lymph" :op2 "node") :ARG1-of (p2 / pericystic-01 :ARG2 (a2 / anatomical-site :name (n3 / name :op1 "duct")))) :ARG2 (d / disease-disorder :name (n2 / name :op1 "adenocarcinoma")))

roleset.note: NOTES: Added for THYME-AMR. Most other peri- frames have just one argument since the reference entity is typically a shadow argument/inherent in the meaning of the fame. The occurrence in some clinical texts of "pericystic duct," plus the variable referent of cystic (bladder or cyst) motivates the two arguments here. For AMR multi-sentence linking, it might be desirable to add analogous arguments to the other peri- frames as well down the road.
